section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: This section introduces the fundamental concepts of variables and data types in Python. Learners will understand how to store and manipulate different kinds of data using variables. These building blocks are essential for writing effective Python programs.
learning_objectives: Declare and assign values to variables in Python.
Identify and use common data types including integers, floats, strings, and booleans.
Use the type() function to check the data type of a variable.
Convert between different data types using type casting.
Apply variables and data types to solve simple programming problems.

lessons.lesson_objective: Declare and assign values to variables using proper naming conventions.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create three variables: 'name' (string), 'age' (integer), and 'height' (float). Assign your own information to them and print each variable on a separate line.

lessons.lesson_objective: Identify and use integers, floats, strings, and booleans in Python programs.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create one variable for each data type: int, float, str, and bool. Use the type() function to print the data type of each variable.

lessons.lesson_objective: Manipulate strings using concatenation and basic string methods.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create two string variables: 'first_name' and 'last_name'. Concatenate them into a full name and print it in uppercase. Then print the length of the full name.

lessons.lesson_objective: Convert between data types and verify types using built-in functions.
key_topics: Using type() to check data type

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a string variable with a number (e.g., '25'). Convert it to an integer, then to a float. Print the value and type at each step.
Ask the user to input their birth year as a string. Convert it to an integer, subtract it from 2024, and print their approximate age as a formatted string.
